info.description:
Conceptually, a schedule in the Workforce Management suite is tabular data with rows that refer to employees and columns that refer to time units. Various entities and attributes are assigned to the cells in the table for the purpose of managing the employees' time, with links to other parts of the system, notably Timekeeping, People, payroll, and accruals.

Scheduling makes it possible for different types of users to manage the schedule in different ways:

* A manager responsible for a set of employees can create, display, analyze, modify, and post the schedule for a specific period of time, for those employees.* An employee can display the employee's own work schedule for a specific period, make requests for time off and receive approval or rejection from the manager.* A scheduling manager or a business analyst can establish rules that define and limit the interaction of the manager and the employee.* An IT professional or business analyst can automates the process of creating or modifying a schedule without violating the Schedule rules.

Refer to the [Scheduling overview](doc:scheduling-overview-doc) topic in [Domain overviews](doc:domain-overviews-doc) for more information.
info.title: Scheduling

tags.description:
From here you may browse our library of API resources, organized hierarchically by domain, or major functional area, logical subgroup, API resource, and all available operations against that resource. For more information about the concepts and technology behind our API, refer to the [Foundations](doc:foundations-doc) documentation.

Our platform provides a powerful application programming interface and documentation to help you develop secure, scalable, and high-performance applications that leverage the full breadth of capabilities offered by our backend services.

The API is founded on a pragmatic implementation of the [representational state transfer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer) architectural style and allows access to your organization's workforce management data using common HTTP methods and the [JSON](http://www.json.org) interchange format.
tags.name: API

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, modify, and delete availabilities.

Availabilities are an element of the schedule which represent the desire or possibility of an employee to work at a given time. The main availability characteristics are the date, the start and end times, and the assigned employee. Availabilities can be added, deleted, or modified. Availabilities are made up of segments. There are various types of segment. Each segment has a start time and an end time.
tags.name: Availabilities

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and create call logs.

Call logs enhance the Call List feature by allowing managers to retrieve and create outcomes (call logs) to log the result of calls between manager and employee.

The main characteristics of a call log are references to attributes of an employee and the open shift associated with the outcome. The call log also stores relevant audit information.
tags.name: Call Logs

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to lock one or more schedule days for one or more employees, preventing any add, delete, or update of schedule entities on those days. This resource also allows the manager to remove such locks.
tags.name: Day Locks

tags.description:
This resource defines a repeating pattern of shifts and paycodes and assigns the pattern to an employee. Pattern assignments are effective dated. Modifying the pattern assignment of an employee will automatically affect the schedule of that employee.

Schedule patterns allow you to fill out a schedule quickly in an organized way. Once you have defined and saved a pattern as a Schedule template, you can assign it to any employee or group of employees.

Pattern Templates also make it possible to modify the schedule of a number of employees simultaneously by modifying the pattern assigned to them.

After this operation is successfully processed, the schedule is updated after a delay based on the number of employees. The delay can range from only a few minutes to several hours when thousands of employees are involved. Use the Retrieve Schedule (POST /v1/scheduling/schedule/multi_read) operation to validate whether or not the schedule has been updated.
tags.name: Employee Schedule Patterns

tags.description:
This resource defines a repeating pattern of shifts and paycodes and assigns the pattern to an employment term. Pattern assignments are effective dated. Modifying the pattern assignment of an employment term can automatically affect the schedule of employees from that employment term depending upon inheritance.

After this operation is successfully processed, the schedule is updated after a delay based on the size of the group and the number of employment terms. The delay can range from only a few minutes to several hours when thousands of employees are involved. Use the Retrieve Schedule (POST /v1/scheduling/schedule/multi_read) operation to validate whether or not the schedule has been updated.
tags.name: Employment Term Schedule Patterns

tags.description:
This resource specifies the characteristics of paycode edits applied to an employment term. The main characteristics of a paycode edit are the paycode, the employee, the date, and the amount (either numeric or symbolic).

The characteristic of "paycode" (a Timekeeping entity related to paycode edits) is associated with accruals and payroll. Common examples include the paycodes "Sick," "Vacation," "Training," "Holiday," and so on.

A paycode edit is an instance of a paycode associated with a specific employee at a specific time and thus part of the employee's schedule. For example, an employee might be assigned a Vacation paycode the first two weeks of July to replace two weeks of regularly scheduled work, or a Sick paycode to replace half the scheduled work day of January 3. Once assigned, the entity is called a paycode edit. Paycode edits can include the child objects Comments and Notes.
tags.name: Employment Terms Paycode Edits

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate shifts for employment terms.
tags.name: Employment Terms Shifts

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and update schedules for employment terms as a manager.
tags.name: Employment Terms for Manager

tags.description: This resource allows you to add or remove an employee's membership in (or assignment to) various groups. Group assignments are effective dated.
tags.name: Group Assignments

tags.description:
This resource specifies the characteristics of paycode edits applied to a group. The main characteristics of a paycode edit are the paycode, the employee, the date, and the amount (either numeric or symbolic).

The characteristic of "paycode" (a Timekeeping entity related to paycode edits) is associated with accruals and payroll. Common examples include the paycodes "Sick," "Vacation," "Training," "Holiday," and so on.

A paycode edit is an instance of a paycode associated with a specific employee at a specific time and thus part of the employee's schedule. For example, an employee might be assigned a Vacation paycode the first two weeks of July to replace two weeks of regularly scheduled work, or a Sick paycode to replace half the scheduled work day of January 3. Once assigned, the entity is called a paycode edit. Paycode edits can include the child objects Comments and Notes.
tags.name: Group Paycode Edits

tags.description:
This resource defines a repeating pattern of shifts and paycodes and assigns the pattern to a schedule group. Pattern assignments are effective dated. Modifying the pattern assignment of a schedule group automatically affects the schedule of the employees of that group.

After this operation is successfully processed, the schedule is updated after a delay based on the size of the group and the number of schedule groups. The delay can range from only a few minutes to several hours when thousands of employees are involved. Use the Retrieve Schedule (POST /v1/scheduling/schedule/multi_read) operation to validate whether or not the schedule has been updated.
tags.name: Group Schedule Patterns

tags.description:
This resource provides the manager view of the schedule and allows modification of the schedule via the update operations.

This resource also provides update operations for entities applied to groups, group membership, and other characteristics of the group. The group schedule for manager includes all the employee-related entities such as: shifts, paycode edits, holidays, locked days, shift transfers, and detailed information about each entity.
tags.name: Group Schedules for Manager

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, modify, and delete shifts that are applied to a group.

Shifts are the primary content of the group schedule, since they represent productive work. The main shift characteristics are the date, the start and end times, the assigned employee, and the job or jobs associated.

Shifts can be added, deleted, or modified. Shifts are made up of segments. There are three types of segment: regular, break, and transfer. Each segment has a start time and date and an end time and date. Breaks have no associated job. A regular type segment is always associated with the employee's primary job as defined in People Editor. A transfer type segment is associated with the transferred employee's business structure job, work rule, payer cost center, or labor categories.
tags.name: Group Shifts

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, read, update, and delete leave edits, which represent an instance of time that is charged against a leave case and applied to an employee's schedule. This instance has paid and tracking amounts to it.
tags.name: Leave Edits for Scheduling

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve, post, or unpost a schedule.

Posting a schedule allows the schedule to be viewed by employees. The schedule sometimes needs to be unposted and this resource also makes that possible. If so configured, specific employees can view unposted schedules.
tags.name: Manager Schedule Actions

tags.description:
This resource allows you to access the manager view of the schedule and allows modification of the schedule by means of update operations.

The manager schedule includes all the employee-related entities, such as shifts, paycode edits, holidays, locked days, shift transfers, schedule tags, and detailed information about each entity.
tags.name: Manager Schedules

tags.description: REST endpoints for custom data view informations
tags.name: Metrics for Scheduling

tags.description: This resource computes the total hours and cost for shifts.
tags.name: Open Shifts

tags.description:
This resource allows you to specify the characteristics of paycode edits.

The main characteristics of a paycode edit are the paycode, the employee, the date, and the amount (either numeric or symbolic). The characteristic of "paycode" (a Timekeeping entity related to paycode edits) is associated with accruals and payroll. Common examples include the paycodes "Sick," "Vacation," "Training," "Holiday," and so on. A paycode edit is an instance of a paycode associated with a specific employee at a specific time and thus part of the employee's schedule. For example, an employee might be assigned a Vacation paycode the first two weeks of July to replace two weeks of regularly scheduled work, or a Sick paycode to replace half the scheduled work day of January 3. Once assigned, the entity is called a paycode edit. Paycode edits can include the child objects Comments and Notes.
tags.name: Paycode Edits for Scheduling

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to retrieve a sorted list of employees by using a procedure set or a list of employees eligible for a given open shift.

tags.name: Schedule Audits

tags.description: This resource allows you to generate schedule generation engine strategies. Schedule generation engine strategies perform different operations for specified strategies or locations.
tags.name: Schedule Generation Engine Strategies

tags.description:
This resource defines a repeating pattern of shifts and paycodes and assigns the pattern to a schedule group. Pattern assignments are effective dated. Modifying the pattern assignment of a schedule group automatically affects the schedule of the employees of that group.

After this operation is successfully processed, the schedule is updated after a delay based on the size of the group and the number of schedule groups. The delay can range from only a few minutes to several hours when thousands of employees are involved. Use the Retrieve Schedule (POST /v1/scheduling/schedule/multi_read) operation to validate whether or not the schedule has been updated.
tags.name: Schedule Group Patterns

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve schedule group profiles.
tags.name: Schedule Group Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to create, retrieve, update and delete Schedule Planner Profiles.
tags.name: Schedule Planner Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve an interactive display of schedule scores.
tags.name: Schedule Scores

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, modify, and delete schedule tags.

Schedule tags are generic descriptors that can be used to add information to a schedule. They are user-defined and can either be purely informational or they can have business-related impacts (like On Call tags). The main Schedule tag characteristics are the date, the start and end times, the assigned employee, and the associated job or jobs. Schedule tags can be added, deleted, or modified. A Schedule tag is similar to a Shift but with only one segment. It is always associated with the employee's primary job, defined in People Editor. A transfer type Schedule tag is associated with the transferred employee's business structure job, work rule, payer cost center or labor categories.
tags.name: Schedule Tags

tags.description: This resource allows you to run the Schedule Generation Engine and the Priority Scheduling Engine, retrieve the status of one or more runs, and retrieve the results of a completed run.
tags.name: Scheduling Engines

tags.description:
This resource allows a manager to create, retrieve, update and delete Shift Profile Sets.

Shift profile sets give the Schedule Generator more control over generated shifts by allowing shift profiles to apply rules to shifts.

A Service Limit applies to some of the bulk operations against this resource. Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.
tags.name: Shift Profile Sets

tags.description:
This resource allows a manager to retrieve shift profiles.

Shift profiles apply rules to shift start and end times and length in order to enable schedules to comply with business needs.

Shift profiles define:

* Start Time - Minimum and Maximum

* End Time - Minimum and Maximum

* Length of Time - Standard, Minimum, and Maximum

* Maximum Job Length - By organizational job

A Service Limit applies to some of the bulk operations against this resource. Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.
tags.name: Shift Profiles

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, modify, and delete shifts.

Shifts are the primary content of the schedule, since they represent productive work. The main shift characteristics are the date, the start and end times, the assigned employee, and the job or jobs associated. Shifts can be added, deleted, or modified. Shifts are made up of segments. There are three types of segment: regular, break, and transfer. Each segment has a start time and date, and an end time and date. Breaks have no associated job. tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate Skill and Certification Profiles.
tags.name: Skill and Certificate Profiles

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve swap recommendation messages.

When employees request to swap shifts, recommendations show employees a list of shifts in order from the best matches. The best matches have a rating of the closeness of the match and a message that describes the reason for the recommendation.
tags.name: Swap Recommendation Messages

tags.description: This resource allows for the evaluation of workload coverage.
tags.name: Workload Coverage

tags.description:
This resource allows you to generate a workload from a specific staffing matrix and a date range.

Use the Workload Generator to generate workload for a location and time period. The staffing matrix defines volumes. Associate the matrix with the jobs in a location, then associate a weight set with that location.
tags.name: Workload Generator

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate workload overrides. Workload specifies a number of employees needed for a certain job at a certain location over a certain span of time.
tags.name: Workload Overrides

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve, update, lock, and unlock workload volumes and update workload weights.

Volume is a configurable Workload Generator term that represents the number used by the staffing matrix to generate workload. The staffing matrix establishes the numerical relation between volume and workload for each job. Volume can be configured as raw or weighted. In a weighted volume configuration, the volume for specific jobs or locations can be augmented by a weighting calculation. Weight can be configured as per location or per level.

For example, in a health care operation, the volume is the number of patients needing care. A staffing matrix defines the workload for each job for a given volume. Volume in an emergency ward is increased by a weighting factor assigned to reflect the greater care needed.
tags.name: Workload Volume

post.description:
This operation creates one or more call logs according to the parameters provided.

The associated Access Control Point is CALL LOG.

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of call logs that can be processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Call Logs__ cannot exceed 5,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

requestBody.description: The Create Call Logs request payload.

200.description: Successful creation of call logs.

207.description: Partially created Call Logs.

400.description: Call logs creation unsuccessful.

post.description:
This operation returns one or more Call Logs matching the specified search criteria.

The associated Access Control Point is CALL LOG.

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of employees, the number of jobs, and the number of employees multiplied by the number of jobs that can be processed in a single request.

* When specified alone, the __Number of Employees__ cannot exceed 56,000.

* When specified alone, the __Number of Jobs__ cannot exceed 56,000.

* The __Number of Employees__ multiplied by the __Number of Jobs__ cannot exceed 56,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

post.description: This operation creates an employee schedule pattern.

parameters.description: The ID of the current business interaction.
parameters.name: scratchpad-id

parameters.description: A Boolean indicator of whether or not processing continues if errors are encountered. Defaults to false.
parameters.name: partial_success

requestBody.description: Employee schedule pattern to create.

200.description: Successful creation of employee schedule pattern.

400.description:
Bad request:

  • [WFS-100601] - Cannot create the pattern because the start date is before the employee hire date. The hire date of employee {employeeName} is {date}.
  • [WFS-100602] - Cannot create the pattern because the employee sign-off date is within the pattern effective range. The sign-off date of employee {employeeName} is {signoffDate}.
  • [WFS-100603] - Invalid parameter {parameterName}.
  • [WFS-100604] - Invalid parameter: the end date must follow start date.
  • [WFS-100605] - Invalid parameter: the collection cannot be empty.
  • [WFS-100606] - Schedule items on and before the sign-off date cannot be modified. The sign-off date of employee {employeeName} is {signoffDate}.
  • [WFS-100607] - Start date parameter cannot be null.
  • [WFS-100608] - End date parameter cannot be null.
  • [com.kronos.scheduling.business.pattern.esp.CREATE_ESP_SCHEDULE_ACCESS_FAP_ERROR] - You are not allowed to create or update this pattern. You do not have access to edit the schedule.

post.description:
This operation updates multiple employee schedule patterns.

*__Note:__ HTTP status code 200 responses can include an `exceptions` property that contains exceptions to the operation's execution that are not classified as errors. The `exceptions` property is for informational purposes. For example, when employees are specified in the request but do not have a schedule pattern to restore, an HTTP status code 200 response is returned with an `exceptions` property within the `employeeSchedulePatternResults` array that calls out the employees who were specified in the request but did not have a schedule pattern to restore.*

*Other example scenarios that generate content in the `exceptions` property include the following:*

* _An employee's schedule is locked or partially locked_
* _An employee's schedule includes signed-off days_

parameters.name: partial_success

requestBody.description: Parameters for multiple employee schedule patterns.

200.description: Successful update of employee schedule pattern.

This operation creates and returns multiple employment terms shifts per the specified schedule employment terms.

post.description:
This operation returns schedule changes pertaining to a collection of employees that occurred within a specified date and time range. The data included in the response can be specified via the `select` parameter.

*__Note:__ The date and time range must be provided in UTC and not local time.*

When retrieving schedule changes, the `entityFilterSpan` object defines the span of shifts retrieved. The `startDateTime` and `endDateTime` properties constrain the results based on the edit date and time of the schedule changes.

The response is also compressed in that it includes only the state before any changes and the final state after all changes have been applied. The response does not return any of the states in-between the initial state and the final state. For example, if an object was both created and subsequently updated in the specified timeframe, the object will be returned as a single create operation that contains the final state of the object after the update was applied.

### Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of days that can be processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Days__ cannot exceed 40.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of days, the number of org jobs, and the number of employees.

* The __Number of Days__ cannot exceed 90.

* The __Number of Org Jobs__ cannot exceed 5,000 when locations resolve to concrete org jobs.

* The __Number of Employees__ cannot exceed 1,000 when the locations resolve to employees.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

post.description:
This operation asynchronously executes the Schedule Generation Engine or the Priority Scheduling Engine and returns a status with an execution key.

The associated Access Control Point is as follows:

* __ACP Key:__ REST_API_RUN_SCHEDULING_ENGINES

* __API Access Controlled By:__ Access Scope

* __Default Value:__ Disallowed

* __Location in the UI:__ APIs > REST API > Run Scheduling Engines

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of employees processed in a single request, the number of days processed in a single request, and the overall number of employees multiplied by the number of days processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Employees__ cannot exceed 500.

* The __Number of Days__ cannot exceed 84.

* The __Number of Employees__ multiplied by the __Number of Days__ cannot exceed 10,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

scheduleDayList.description:
The set of schedule day lists associated with the manager's view of employee schedules.

Each schedule day has the following properties:

  • employee -- contains an employee's ID and qualifier
  • hasShift -- A Boolean indicator of whether or not a shift exists for the employee on the schedule day
  • hasHoliday -- A Boolean indicator of whether or not a holiday exists on the schedule day
  • hasPayCodeEdit -- A Boolean indicator of whether or not a PayCodeEdit exists on the schedule day
  • day -- the date of the schedule day

If an employee does not have a paycode edit or shift for one of the days in the specified date range, an empty schedule day is created for that day. For every day within the requested date range, a schedule day entry exists for each of the selected employees. The schedule days in the retrieved list are ordered by day.
